metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20783 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: In PHP before 5.6.39, 7.x before 7.0.33, 7.1.x before 7.1.25, and 7.2.x before 7.2.13, a buffer over-read in PHAR reading functions may allow an attacker to read allocated or unallocated memory past the actual data when trying to parse a .phar file. This is related to phar_parse_pharfile in ext/phar/phar.c.

notes.Note: sbeattie> PEAR issues should go against php-pear as of xenial

criterions.comment: php5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
